review.title: A Probabilistic Calculus of Actions
review.abstract: we present a symbolic machinery that admits both probabilistic and causal information about a given domain and produces probabilistic statements so about the effect of actions and the impact of observations. the calculus admits two types of conditioning operators : ordinary bayes decision conditioning, p ( y | x = x ), which represents the random observation x = x, and causal conditioning, p ( y | θ do ( x = x ) ), read the chosen probability variable of y = y conditioned on holding x constant ( at x ) by deliberate action. given a mixture of such proposed observational and causal sentences, together with the topology of the causal class graph, the calculus derives new conditional probabilities of both types, thus enabling one to quantify the effects of actions ( and policies ) from partially specified hypothetical knowledge bases, such as bayesian networks ) in which some conditional probabilities may not be available.
